column2: Tea Enthusiasts
A society for the gentler folk, who enjoy nothing more than a delicious cup of tea on a crisp morning, and a friend to share the delight with.
Enthusiast
Tea Lover
Gifted Brewer
Master of Leaves
Enthusiast
Tea Lover
Gifted Brewess
Mistress of Leaves

There are those out there who feel lost, suffering wounds the eye cannot see. Sometimes it helps knowing someone out there cares for them, who's willing to sit down and listen to their problems over a cup of tea.\nWould you be so kind to find someone in pain, and give them the console they need?
Share Tea with Someone in Pain
Remove a negative trait from someone by §Ysharing tea§! with them.
Thank you for taking the time to share tea with someone in pain. Sometimes, the best way to solve your own problems is to help someone else.
Such wise words!
You! Yes you! You've joined our society, but are you really committed to our noble cause? Show us your devotion! Go make yourself a cup of tea!
Make a Cup of Tea in Real Life
Make a cup of tea in §Yreal life§!, then go complete the §YI Made a Cup of Tea§! decision.
Well, were you able to make a cup of tea for yourself?
Yes, I made a cup of tea!
Sorry, but I didn't have any tea to make...
That's excellent! Tea is wonderful for your health, and it tastes delicious!
I am a True Tea Enthusiast!
That's alright, there is no shame in being honest. Not everyone can up and make tea at the drop of a hat!
Thank you for understanding.

Besides our love of tea, we in the society bond over time spent together. That's why it's appreciated when someone puts in the effort to host a tea party. Why not give it a try? You'll have to gather some ingredients, first, but then you'll be well on your way.
Gather Tea Ingredients
Complete the §YSearch for Tea Ingredients§! decision.
Excellent! With the ingredients you've gathered, the time has come to throw the party! Send out the invitations immediately!
Host Tea Party
Complete the §YHost a Tea Party§! decision.

The world moves so fast, and we can often find ourselves swept away by all the worries and responsibilities of day-to-day life. \nWhy not take an afternoon off, and simply enjoy the beauty of nature with a steaming cup of tea?
Take An Afternoon Off
Complete the §YTake an Afternoon Off§! decision.
So how did you enjoy your afternoon off? Did you find it enlightening?
Yes! It was very fruitful!
While it is always best to believe in oneself, a little help from others can be a great blessing. Have you considered sharing the wisdom of kindness with someone, over a hot cup of tea?
Teach Kindness
Teach someone the §YKind§! trait by sharing  §YEnlightening Tea§! with them.
The seeds of kindness sewn might seem small, but will one day grow into a profound forest of virtue.
Teaching kindness is its own reward.
Not everyone is as blessed with knowledge as we are. Some have struggled through life, and now suffer without a proper education. Go, take some time to be a teacher, and use your wisdom as a charity!
Educate Someone in Need
§YEducate§! someone who has a level one (lowest) §YEducation.§!
None are so close to spiritual harmony as passionate teachers, for they are the embodiment of all good -- patience, knowledge, and a desire to see others grow strong.
May my students surpass me, and find outstanding greatness.

As the seasons change, so too do feelings of love inevitably turn to feelings of loss. It is a sad, beautiful cycle, pressed upon us from the dawn of humanity. So go, live and love with your family! Cherish these moments before you no longer can!
Focus on Family
Choose the §YFamily§! focus.
I'm so pleased to hear you're spending more time with your family! Even unbreakable bonds sometimes need tempering!
I applaud your wisdom.

You seem quite perplexed with the world outside our own, bordering on obsession. And as much as we love you at the table, you'll never find the answers you seek simply taking tea with us.\nWhy not consort with the spirits themselves? You'll find the forest a holy place, of sorts, for them.
Take Tea Near Spirits
Complete the §YTake Tea Near the Spirits§! decision.
How was your journey into the woods? Did you find what you were looking for?
The spirits held court, and I was there to witness!
Being so close to the otherworldly... it invigorated my soul.

You've helped those with wounded minds before, but there are some even more broken, suffering in ways we cannot imagine. \nWith your attunement to the Spirit World, you should be able to brew a mystical tea, capable of healing even the deepest mental scars. Please, do this kindness.
Heal a Broken Mind
Remove §YDepressed§!, §YPossessed§!, or §YInsane§! from someone by sharing §YSpiritual Tea§! with them.
I know this task was difficult, but your selflessness healed someone others believed beyond redemption.
It was not by my hand the healing was done, but the Spirits.

The water of the Northern tribes is fascinating, isn't it? Of course, it's well known for its healing properties, but it can also invigorate the spirit, even when the flesh is... less willing.\nCould you possibly seek out someone who's struggling with a... diminished spirit... and help them? I'm sure their spouse will be grateful.
Help Someone With Fertility
Give someone with no children and a spouse §YHerbal Tea§!.
You've done a magnificent deed, helping someone who might have been too afraid to ask for help in the first place. Surely, your efforts have sewn the seeds of friendship and love.
Among other seeds, yes.

I can sense you feel troubled puzzling over the mysteries of the world. With so many distractions, it's hard to find the time to sit down and read a good book! Why not redirect that energy, so that you may pursue your true passion?
Focus on Theology
Choose the §YTheology§! focus.
It's wonderful to hear your using your free time to learn about the spirits! Just remember to come visit us from time to time, and not spend your whole life squirreled away in a library.
My wisdom will be applauded!
Ahh, welcome, new friend! It would be an honour to have you join us as we carouse the tea shops around town. Please, have a seat, and allow me to pour you a fresh cup.
Some jasmine tea would be lovely!
Gazing into your reflection off the top of a freshly brewed chamomile tea, you begin to wonder why you've let such cruelty into your heart.
Why am I always so jealous?
Why am I always so angry?
Sipping a cup of masterfully brewed jasmine tea, you begin to feel your worries drift into nothingness.
Life is fleeting, I should enjoy what I have.
Spending time with your fellow tea-lovers, you feel a budding joy simply taking an afternoon to be in the company of others.
What a relaxing life I lead.
This is the gossip I live for!
I should invite someone over for tea.

Lately you've been taking your tea alone, squirreled away in a quiet corner at the local library, drawn in by your fascination with the spirits. There are so many stories, from so many cultures! Is there anything more relaxing than a cup of chamomile and a good book?
Ah, I've never heard of this spirit before!
I should bring a few of these volumes home with me.
Oh? A book on herbal teas?
I can tell from the way you hold yourself, you are in great pain. Please, sit down with me and have a cup of tea, so that maybe we can discuss your woes.
I would love to sit down for some tea.
No dirty leaf water for me, thanks.
Thank you for the delightful tea the other day! We must do this again sometime!
Anytime!
I consider myself quite wise in the ways of the world, and if you'd be interested, I think I could teach you a thing or two!
I could use the help!
No, your services will not be needed.
I've brewed a special blend of tea, from rare Chi-enhancing herbs, that I want you to have. It will surely make your bending more powerful!
What a rare tea!

Since joining the Tea Enthusiasts, you've felt friendlier, more robust, and much more relaxed than you once did. In your newfound calmness, you find your mind drifting... first to your new friends, and the immense joy they've brought you, then to nature, where the leaves grow, and where spirits prance the world unseen. Both fascinating and mysterious, you can't help but feel a resonating connection to...
... The Self, the friends we have now, and the one life we lead!
... The Spirits, hidden and wise, the manifestation of nature!
The Paths We Walk

Spending an afternoon relaxing, your mind begins to drift, and you find yourself thinking about all the people you've shared tea with. All of them are so soft-spoken, and kind, and truly happy -- such a lifestyle is worth aspiring to.
I should be more like them!
I am blessed to have so many friends!
That's not me. I'm happiest with a good book!
Perhaps I should host more tea parties?
A fleeting thought, nothing more.

Slipping away from the humdrum city, you find yourself deep in the woods, accompanied only by the pleasant sounds of nature. After some time hiking, you find the perfect clearing to sit and rest. Setting a small fire to warm your kettle, you once again feel your mind begin to wander -- faintly, you hear the spirits chirping around you, pondering who you are. If only you could unravel their mysteries!
To understand the unseen, such a noble undertaking!
The more time I spend in the wilderness, the clearer their voices become.
The mystery is alluring... But I'd rather be with friends.
Such guile! I could learn from how they sneak!
A fleeting thought, nothing more.

Your time with the Tea Enthusiasts has been inspirational, and over the last few weeks, you've been mulling the idea of growing a tea-leaf garden of your own. Others have done it, so why not you? Mind abuzz with thoughts of hosting tea parties with homegrown blends, you start considering the cost of such an endeavour.
Gardening books! New tools! Fertilisers! Every coin is worth it!
I can get started on a modest budget.
How hard can it be to buy some seeds and water some plants?
Unfortunately, the tea bushes you planted did not take. Perhaps gardening is not your strong suite.
Unfortunate.

It may have started slow, but your tea garden is finally bearing fruit -- or rather, leaves. In celebration, you decide to christen your harvest by inviting over your friends for tea, in what will surely be the first of many such parties.
Drink up, everyone!

You've spent quite a lot of time enjoying the tea-leaf garden you inherited, both in harvesting leaves, and handing out packets of seeds to friends who adore your tea. Lately, though, you can't help but feel the garden is a bit... small. Your ancestor was a master caretaker, and the bushes they planted are well bred... but everything is so confined! Surely, by spreading such strong seeds to nearby land, your estate will flourish with tea bushes.
I'll hire some gardeners to make sure the new bushes are tended.
Time to get my hands dirty!
Perhaps I should add some sacred soil from the forest?
Let me just throw around some seeds, and see what happens.
On second thought, the garden is a fine size.
After several years of waiting, the tea bushes you cast seeds for never took root. Perhaps your ancestor knew better, and that's why they stuck with such a small garden.
At least I still have the garden.

Several years ago, you planted tea seeds around your land, hoping to expand a single garden to a near-jungle of tea leaves. Peaking out your window, you now overlook a resplendent grove, bustling with bushes, dotted with all sorts of hybrids growing among them. Truly, there is nowhere on your estate you can go where a tea bush isn't within reach.
I think I'm getting the hang of this!
What strange leaves! I wonder what the tea will taste like?

Some time ago, your family planted a tea-leaf garden on the estate, and after allowing those bushes to expand into the surrounding nature, ended up with a vibrant grove entangled everything nearby. Of course, this gift was part of your inheritance -- after so many generations of caretakers, the responsibility finally falls on you to maintain it.
Perhaps there is more I can do?

Surveying the untamed wilds of leaves and vines, you begin to think of how else you might manage such a grove. Why stop at just tending and pruning? With a little organisation, this grove could be developed into a real farm, with a set harvest, and a knowledgeable staff overseeing it.
Find me the best farmers in the land, and I will pay handsomely!
I will plead my case to the townsfolk to help!
I will seek guidance from the Spirits, to form a plan!
I can pay some farmers modestly to handle this.
This will be too expensive.

You wipe the sweat from your brow as you head in, satisfied after a hard day's work in the field. What was once untamed and erratic is now a meticulously organised farm, with rows of bushes, and even set ground for crossbreeding new tea leaves. It wasn't easy, but because of your efforts, you were able to reign in the grove you were handed-down, and make the harvest even more bountiful.
Just an honest day's work.
Thank the Spirits for blessing my estate.
Once again looking out upon your estate, you see your efforts to tame the wilds have been largely frivolous. You tried your best, but perhaps it just wasn't meant to be.
Oh well, I can still enjoy the grove.

Your family's tea farm has become quite famous, boasting not only generations of caretakers, but generations of patrons. However, that popularity ends at your borders -- truthfully, as well tended as the farms are, their tea production simply isn't high enough to meet the demand outside your own lands. Puzzling over this problem, you lock yourself in your study.
Hmm...

Labouring into the night, you draw up plans for a grand plantation -- not just one, but tens or perhaps even hundreds of well-tended farms. You will drive production so high that every tea shop across the Four Nations will stock your familial blends. Such an endeavour will be massive, and thus your plan will have to be meticulous.
No cost is too great.
This will be our glory! This will be the plantation of the people!
I have sought the Spirits before, I shall do so again!
If I'm careful, I can do this on a budget.
I need more time to gather resources.

After almost a decade of labour, your grand vision has been realised: from a humble garden, to a blossoming grove, to a well-kept farm, and now finally to this, a colossal plantation, the absolute apex of a generational love of tea and the desire to spread that passion. Perusing the newly-leafed fields, you think back to all the work your forefathers put in before you, and how all of this must have started with a single inspirational thought after a warm cup of tea. You also think forward, to your children, and their children, and all your descendants, who will always have this plantation as part of their lives, and will feel you and your ancestors love through it. What you've built here isn't just a handful of farms, it's a monument to your whole family, past and future, and by the Spirits, it is glorious!
It is magnificent!

It would seem that starting a tea plantation is much more difficult then it seems. Although there's no recouping the money you've sunk into this, you feel like any more investments would just be a waste of time.
The farm is enough, I suppose.

Construct Tea Leaf Garden

Expand Garden into a Grove
Having received a Tea Leaf Garden from one of their ancestors, members of the §YTea Enthusiasts§! can opt to let the garden expand wildly, blossoming into an entire grove.
Expand Grove into a Farm
With a vibrant grove of tea leaves now lush and sprawling, members of the §YTea Enthusiasts§! can create bountiful tea-farms, taming the once-wilds.
Expand Farm into a Plantation
Finishing what their ancestors started, members of the §YTea Enthusiasts§! can take their developed farms and construct a glorious monument to their generational love of tea.

After years of practise and careful study, you're finally ready to become a Tea Master! Gives a boost to Diplomacy, Health, and increases the chance sharing any type of tea will result in friendship.

Oh? A book on herbal teas?
I can tell from the way you hold yourself, you are in great pain. Please, sit down with me and have a cup of tea, so that maybe we can discuss your woes.
I would love to sit down for some tea.
No dirty leaf water for me, thanks.
Thank you for the delightful tea the other day! We must do this again sometime!
Anytime!
I consider myself quite wise in the ways of the world, and if you'd be interested, I think I could teach you a thing or two!
I could use the help!
No, your services will not be needed.
I've brewed a special blend of tea, from rare Chi-enhancing herbs, that I want you to have. It will surely make your bending more powerful!
What a rare tea!

Since joining the Tea Enthusiasts, you've felt friendlier, more robust, and much more relaxed than you once did. In your newfound calmness, you find your mind drifting... first to your new friends, and the immense joy they've brought you, then to nature, where the leaves grow, and where spirits prance the world unseen. Both fascinating and mysterious, you can't help but feel a resonating connection to...
... The Self, the friends we have now, and the one life we lead!
... The Spirits, hidden and wise, the manifestation of nature!
The Paths We Walk

Spending an afternoon relaxing, your mind begins to drift, and you find yourself thinking about all the people you've shared tea with. All of them are so soft-spoken, and kind, and truly happy -- such a lifestyle is worth aspiring to.
I should be more like them!
I am blessed to have so many friends!
That's not me. I'm happiest with a good book!
Perhaps I should host more tea parties?
A fleeting thought, nothing more.

Slipping away from the humdrum city, you find yourself deep in the woods, accompanied only by the pleasant sounds of nature. After some time hiking, you find the perfect clearing to sit and rest. Setting a small fire to warm your kettle, you once again feel your mind begin to wander -- faintly, you hear the spirits chirping around you, pondering who you are. If only you could unravel their mysteries!.
To understand the unseen, such a noble undertaking!
The more time I spend in the wilderness, the clearer their voices become.
The mystery is alluring... But I'd rather be with friends.
Such guile! I could learn from how they sneak!
A fleeting thought, nothing more.

Your time with the Tea Enthusiasts has been inspirational, and over the last few weeks, you've been mulling the idea of growing a tea-leaf garden of your own. Others have done it, so why not you? Mind abuzz with thoughts of hosting tea parties with homegrown blends, you start considering the cost of such an endeavour.
Gardening books! New tools! Fertilisers! Every coin is worth it!
I can get started on a modest budget.
How hard can it be to buy some seeds and water some plants?
Unfortunately, the tea bushes you planted did not take. Perhaps gardening is not your strong suite.
Unfortunate.

It may have started slow, but your tea garden is finally bearing fruit -- or rather, leaves. In celebration, you decide to christen your harvest by inviting over your friends for tea, in what will surely be the first of many such parties.
Drink up, everyone!

You've spent quite a lot of time enjoying the tea-leaf garden you inherited, both in harvesting leaves, and handing out packets of seeds to friends who adore your tea. Lately, though, you can't help but feel the garden is a bit... small. Your ancestor was a master caretaker, and the bushes they planted are well bred... but everything is so confined! Surely, by spreading such strong seeds to nearby land, your estate will flourish with tea bushes.
I'll hire some gardeners to make sure the new bushes are tended.
Time to get my hands dirty!
Perhaps I should add some sacred soil from the forest?
Let me just throw around some seeds, and see what happens.
On second thought, the garden is a fine size.
After several years of waiting, the tea bushes you cast seeds for never took root. Perhaps your ancestor knew better, and that's why they stuck with such a small garden.
At least I still have the garden.

Several years ago, you planted tea seeds around your land, hoping to expand a single garden to a near-jungle of tea leaves. Peaking out your window, you now overlook a resplendent grove, bustling with bushes, dotted with all sorts of hybrids growing among them. Truly, there is nowhere on your estate you can go where a tea bush isn't within reach.
I think I'm getting the hang of this!
What strange leaves! I wonder what the tea will taste like?

Some time ago, your family planted a tea-leaf garden on the estate, and after allowing those bushes to expand into the surrounding nature, ended up with a vibrant grove entangled everything nearby. Of course, this gift was part of your inheritance -- after so many generations of caretakers, the responsibility finally falls on you to maintain it.
Perhaps there is more I can do?

Surveying the untamed wilds of leaves and vines, you begin to think of how else you might manage such a grove. Why stop at just tending and pruning? With a little organisation, this grove could be developed into a real farm, with a set harvest, and a knowledgeable staff overseeing it.
Find me the best farmers in the land, and I will pay handsomely!
I will plead my case to the townsfolk to help!
I will seek guidance from the Spirits, to form a plan!
I can pay some farmers modestly to handle this.
This will be too expensive.

You wipe the sweat from your brow as you head in, satisfied after a hard day's work in the field. What was once untamed and erratic is now a meticulously organised farm, with rows of bushes, and even set ground for crossbreeding new tea leaves. It wasn't easy, but because of your efforts, you were able to reign in the grove you were handed-down, and make the harvest even more bountiful.
Just an honest day's work.
Thank the Spirits for blessing my estate.
Once again looking out upon your estate, you see your efforts to tame the wilds have been largely frivolous. You tried your best, but perhaps it just wasn't meant to be.
Oh well, I can still enjoy the grove.

Your family's tea farm has become quite famous, boasting not only generations of caretakers, but generations of patrons. However, that popularity ends at your borders -- truthfully, as well tended as the farms are, their tea production simply isn't high enough to meet the demand outside your own lands. Puzzling over this problem, you lock yourself in your study.
Hmm..

Labouring into the night, you draw up plans for a grand plantation -- not just one, but tens or perhaps even hundreds of well-tended farms. You will drive production so high that every tea shop across the Four Nations will stock your familial blends. Such an endeavour will be massive, and thus your plan will have to be meticulous.
No cost is too great.
This will be our glory! This will be the plantation of the people!
I have sought the Spirits before, I shall do so again!
If I'm careful, I can do this on a budget.
I need more time to gather resources.

After almost a decade of labour, your grand vision has been realised: from a humble garden, to a blossoming grove, to a well-kept farm, and now finally to this, a colossal plantation, the absolute apex of a generational love of tea and the desire to spread that passion. Perusing the newly-leafed fields, you think back to all the work your forefathers put in before you, and how all of this must have started with a single inspirational thought after a warm cup of tea. You also think forward, to your children, and their children, and all your descendants, who will always have this plantation as part of their lives, and will feel you and your ancestors love through it. What you've built here isn't just a handful of farms, it's a monument to your whole family, past and future, and by the Spirits, it is glorious!
It is magnificent!

It would seem that starting a tea plantation is much more difficult then it seems. Although there's no recouping the money you've sunk into this, you feel like any more investments would just be a waste of time.
The farm is enough, I suppose.

Scrounging around the woods, you grasp bushels of leaves and shove them into your satchel. Maybe they can be used for tea?
I'll figure it out later.
Oh, I could make green tea with these!
The forest is a thriving place, and aside from potential tea leaves, all sorts of fruits and berries are in blossom -- picking a few might add some razzle-dazzle to your tea party.
I'll gather some Bacui berries, as well.
Can't have a tea party without leaves.
Stepping into a clearing, you can't believe your luck -- a White Dragon Bush, in full blossom! This will surely make a delicious brew!
What could possibly go wrong?
Hmm.. is this bush safe? (50%/50%)
No, this isn't what I'm looking for.
Upon close inspection, you determine this is, in fact, a White Dragon Bush. Happily, you gather the leaves you need.
Better safe than sorry!
Looking very closely at the bush, you realise this is a White Jade Bush, and highly poisonous! You shudder to think what may have happened if you gathered these leaves.
Disaster narrowly avoided!

While wandering the forest, you come across a rare sight -- a badger spirit, drinking from a hot spring littered with leaves! Although you are not one to presume you understand their ethereal ways, you begin to feel this creature may be a kindred soul. After all, it seems to be enjoying a cup of tea... of sorts.
Sit down and drink with the spirit!
Wait for it to leave, and grab some of the leaves from the pool.

Gently, you sit down next to the spirit, and although it seems alarmed, it seems to understand you mean it no harm. Filling your cup with the hot-spring brew, the two of you sit and enjoy tea together. After some time, the spirit reaches its paws deep into the pool, and grabs a handful of faintly glowing leaves. It then extends out to you, beckoning you to take them.
Blessed leaves!
Once the spirit finishes its drink, you sneak over to the pool, ready to harvest.
This water is favoured by the Spirits. I should use this for my brews!
The leaves are soggy, but still useable.
Lost in the woods, you happen upon an eerily quiet grove. Although you are alone, you do not feel alone, and listening closely you hear a soft, ethereal chatter. The Spirits surround you!
It's dangerous here, I should grab some leaves and run.
There are scattered berry bushes. Perhaps this is where they feast?
I can hear their voices. They're trying to guide me!
Frustrated at your lack of progress, you at last spot some useable leaves for green tea, although from a sickly looking bush.
It doesn't matter! I need tea leaves!
What I need now are better ingredients.
Spirits, I beseech you, bless my harvest!
Picking through the leaves in your satchel, you find enough to make a moderate amount of tea, perfect for a small group of guests!
I shall serve green tea!
I will delight with White Dragon tea!

Any ingredients you could donation would be appreciated!

Milling about your home, you're surprised to hear a knock on the door. It turns out to be one of your acquaintances, dressed in formal attire, looking puzzled at the empty room. "They said that you were hosting a tea party. Well, I brought biscuits!". It seems as though this poor man is confused, and arrived far too early!
I'm sorry, there's no party here today.
Ah, of course, of course, but we're still in the planning phase!
Oh, I'm sorry to bother you, then. The man seems sullen, but there's not much you can do for him.
It is what it is.
My friend, you came this far out, let's share those biscuits over some tea!

Oh, of course!, the man barges in, excited to see his trip wasn't in vein. The two of you sit for a few hours, gossiping about all sorts of happenings, and in that time you explain you're planning to host a party, so he wasn't entirely wrong. "That sounds marvelous! In that case, here, take some biscuits. They'll be an excellent snack."
Thank you so much!
Your still planning? Even better! The man barges in without a second thought. "Let me ask, have you settled on what tea you want to serve? I have some excellent Jasmine blossoms!"
Actually, I need your help with snacks...
Oh, Jasmine! That sounds delicious!

You remember, when you were much younger, that your family physician was very fond of tea, and was never without a fresh cup. Thinking back, you distinctly remember the aroma of what she drank, but can't put your finger on exactly what it was. Now that you're planning your own party, you think it might be good to visit her and ask.
She only lives a few blocks away.
I don't want to bother her.
Not feeling like harassing an old lady about tea she had decades ago, you instead spend the day perusing the shops, hoping to find something you can use.
Maybe this?

Knocking on her door, you see the wrinkly face of your old physician. Now retired, she spends her days tending plants and enjoying tea by herself. Happy to see you, she invites you in, and admits you're the first company she's had in a long time. Sitting at the table, she hands you a cup, and says "Here, a special herbal tea made from homegrown ginger root".
Ah, it was herbal tea!
Ma'am, would I be able to borrow some of your special ginger root?
I'm planning a grand tea party, and would love some of your ginger root!

Sitting around the table, one of your guests begins speaking in a low-tone. "So... have you heard of this woman named Minerva? She's from the country-side, but she sold everything she owned to attend a gala in Ba Sing Se!". You hear soft chuckles from your other guests, as they begin contributing their own spicy gossip.
Oh, leave that poor girl alone.
You scold your friends for their rudeness.
Well, let me tell you what *I* heard of Minerva!
You contribute your own spicy rumours.
Oh hoho, please, tell me more.
You casually banter about the unfortunate woman.
I'm sure she had a good reason!
You trust the woman had only the best intentions.
That poor woman!
You express sympathy for the woman's misfortune.

Busy in the kitchen, you're interrupted by one of your guests beckoning you to your tea room. "Quick! Quick! Come see this!", he says in a frenzy, as you follow at a hurried pace. When you arrive, you see your good friend, Mushie, a man well into his seventies, with his arm over the shoulder of a girl no older than twenty-five! "There you are!", he says proudly, "I'd like you to meet Lai Ti".
Mushie, you lucky dog!
You congratulate Mushie on dating a girl far younger than he is.
How scandalous! Mushie, she could be your granddaughter!
You accuse Mushie of dating a girl far younger than he is.
Mushie, who is this lovely young lady?
You ask Mushie about the girl, getting the facts before making a judgment.
Ah, I can see the family resemblance!
You recognise quite quickly that this woman is related to Mushie.

Mushie gives you an angry look. "Lai Ti is my granddaughter, not my date. For the Spirits' sake, I'm almost fifty years older than her!". The poor girl looks off to the side, embarrassed by your comment, and she and Mushie storm off. You look at your friend who dragged you from the kitchen, and he shrugs and says "Anyone could have made that mistake!".
What an embarrassment.
Your idiot friend is at fault!

Mushie is taken aback by your statement, and after a moment of uncomfortable silence, he introduces you to the girl who is, in fact, his granddaughter. Not knowing what to say, you stumble for words, and decide to simply avoid Mushie for the rest of the night.
This is awkward.
It really is.

Pleased at your response, Mushie smiles and says "Yes, this is Lai Ti, my granddaughter! She is a bit of an up-and-coming tea enthusiast herself, and when I told her about this party, she jumped at the chance to come!". The girl looks at you and gives a small curtsy. "Thank you for having us", she says, "you are a most gracious host!".
You and Mushie are welcome any time!
Your silver-tongue saved you from a disasterous misunderstanding.

You've got a sharp eye!, Mushie says, "Lai Ti is my granddaugther". The three of you exchange pleasantries, and during that time, your friend who dragged you from the kitchen slinks away in shame. When you catch up with him later, he seems embarrassed at his mistake. "I thought those two were...!", but you stop him. You know exactly what he thought.
This is why you mustn't jump to conclusions!
Your wits helped you avoid an awkward situation.

Humbling and bumbling through your house, getting guests their first few cups of tea, you hear a knock at the door. A late arrival, you presume. When you go to check who it is, you're greeted by a gleeful man holding a huge wicker basket. "Who wants snacks? I brought Fire Flakes!", he bellows to the room.
This is great, I forgot to grab snacks.
Your guests will have fire flakes to munch on.
We already have some biscuits, but we can put these out, too.
You set the fire flakes next to the biscuits.
We already have some berries, but we can put these out, too.
You set the fire flakes next to the berries.
Your guests go hungry.
Your guests delight in the snacks you've served.

Do you have any food? Any morsel I can snack on?, one of your guests asks. "Surely, there's something in the kitchen I can have, I missed lunch and I'm quite starving". You offer the man the what you've got on hand, but you note to yourself that next time, you should probably lay out some food for your hungry guests.
I should have picked up something...
Somehow, your simple tea party has become a banquet. There are so many snacks, truly your guests have a veritable cornucopia of which to choose.
I am a supreme host!

Laying a large platter on the table, your guests marvel at the assortment of cooked berries and dried fruits before them. "Picked them myself, while I was out gathering leaves", you say triumphantly. No sooner do you lay it out than you see fingers greedily digging through the pile, looking for the largest and juiciest among the berries.
I better get some napkins...
Goes well with the White Dragon Tea, if I do say so myself.

You eyes light up when you open your front door and see who's come to join the party. "Did I get the right day this time?", the man says, looking happy to see people stirring behind you. "Ahh, you've put out the biscuits! I brought a few more, just in case!". Shoving his way inside, he moves over to the table, and adds his new biscuits to the batch.
Glad you could make it!
Oh, the sweetness will offset the ginger root!

Taking the huge wicker basket, you lay out several plates on a table off to the side, and let your party know that food has been served. Like a swarm of hungry cat-locusts, your guests descend on the Fire Flakes, and after almost no time, you find the basket has been picked clean.
My considerate friend saved me from such embarrassment!
You hear the steaming from your kettles in the kitchen. Tea time has begun!
Finally!
Your guests wait with eager cups.
That could have been better...
Your guests seem unimpressed with the tea...
Delightful!
Your guests are satisfied with the tea!
This is amazing!
Your guests love the tea!

Regaling your expedition into the woods to your guests, you begin pouring out cups of freshly brewed green tea. "No farms, no special cultivation, just the product of nature's blessing", you boast. As your guests wait for their brews to cool, they begin swapping tales of venturing out into the forest themselves, and all the strange things they encountered therein.
Drink up, everyone!
You pour a hot cup of green tea, and...

Although picked fresh, natural doesn't always mean 'the best', and this green tea is far, far too bitter for your liking. You can see your guests recoiling to the taste as well, but finishing anyway, to not be rude.
Finishing your first cup, you find the green tea delightful. It's not much different than what you'd find in a shop, but it's more satisfying since you picked the leaves yourself.

You barely make it half way through your first cup before you see one of your guests reach for the kettle. "This is the best green tea I've ever had in my life! You must show me where you picked these leaves!". You give a satisfied grin, and promise to take him on your next exploration.

Esteemed guests, today I have a very special treat for you! While exploring the forest, I came across a rare White Dragon tea bush. Picking its leaves, I have prepared a most delicious brew!. You hear a few small claps and gasps as an air of excitement fills the room. Grabbing the freshly brewed pot, you lean in and pour the first cup for a guest. Not hesistating a moment, he takes a sip, and...
You brace for your guest's reaction.
Disaster! The White Dragon leaves you picked were actually White Jade leaves! Your guest kneels over, covered in disgusting red blisters! He needs emergency help!
This party is over, we need to get him to the doctor!
Chaos ensues!
The berries I picked! Quickly, give him some!
You may be able to save him yet!
With no way to help your friend, the other guests grab him and rush him out the door. Your party has ended in catastrophe.
This is a nightmare.
I've brought disgrace to this household!

Not hesitating for a moment, you grab Bacui berries, and feed them to your suffering friend. Within minutes, the rashes go down, and you see him begin to return to normal. However, your other guests still seem quite displeased at your near-fatal mistake.
This could have been a nightmare.
You realise things could have been much worse.

Delicious! Absolutely delicious! Brewed to perfection!, he elates, a smile stretching across his face. "To think we'd get to sample such a rare tea, and so fresh! This is the best tea party I've ever attended!"
Thank you! Anything for my guests!
You served a truly rare tea!

So for today, I decided to go with something classic. Something sweet. That's why I've brewed this fine jasmine tea for us to share. Your guests look at you pleased, taking comfort in the familiarity of the flavor. Sometimes, keeping things simple is the best way to go about.
I hope everyone is thirsty.
You pour a hot cup of jasmine tea, and...
Taking a sip of the tea, you're met with an overwhelming sweetness, ruining the overall flavor. Perhaps the jasmine blossoms you used were no good?

The jasmine tea is as fine as any other, and as you pour cup after cup, you can hear the satisfied sips of your guests. Perhaps what everyone really needed was this -- a relaxing afternoon, with a well-loved blend.

There's an art to brewing tea, and a balance in maintaining the flavor of the drink itself with the added sweetness of the jasmine blossoms. Knowing that, the brew you made today is nothing short of masterful -- an absolutely perfect blend of flavors. Despite being such a familiar tea, you feel refreshed after each sip, and feel proud on how something so common could be made so beautiful.

Recently, I visited a very special family friend of mine, and found out, like me, she was a lover of tea. She generously gave me a sample of ginger root from her own garden, which I've used for today's brew. You gesture to the back of the room, "So everyone, please, say thank you to the woman who made today possible!". Everyone turns and softly claps, and you see your physician begin to blush.

Recently, I visited a very special family friend of mine, and found out, like me, she was a lover of tea. She generously gave me a sample of ginger root from her own garden, which I've used for today's brew. You think of the woman sitting in her home, and part of you wishes she could be here to receive the praise she so rightly deserves.
Good for the heart, and the soul!
You pour a hot cup of green tea, and...

It only occurs to you now that how intensely bitter this ginger tea is. Thinking back, you never asked for the actual recipe your physician used, just for the ginger root itself. Even your guests, trying to be polite, can't help but wince with each sip.

Although you wouldn't call it flavorless, it's clear that the ginger tea you have is medicinal. Still, your guests don't seem to mind -- most of them are elderly, and they can appreciate a blend good for the heart.

What a unique flavor! Part of you believed the tea would be intensely bitter, but it is somehow bitter and... sweet? Whatever your physician gave you, it is her own creation, and you truly cannot think of another tea like this one. Your guests seem baffled, too, as you hear chatter flare up trying to solve the mysteries behind this wonderful blend.

Instead of lively chat, your party is mostly murmurs. Your guests don't seem to have much to talk about, and are only taking small sips of the tea you've laid out for them. Perhaps the ingredients weren't as good as you hoped.
Maybe they're just lost in thought?
For a party, it's unusually quiet...
Lifting your kettle, you feel like your brew has almost run out. Your guests seem entertained, so you take a moment to sneak off back to the kitchen to make some more tea. Things are going well!
My guests are having a good time!
You're having a very comfy day.
Another cup!, calls one of your guests. "Same for me!", shouts another. Your colleagues are downing the tea so quickly, it's hard to keep up!
Everything about today is perfect!
Your guests will be talking about this party for quite some time.

One of your colleagues pulls you aside, to privately ask you a question. "I hate to be a bother, but what did you put in this tea? Aches and pains I've grown to know have vanished, and my knees feel like they did twenty years ago!". You smile wryly, knowing full well the hot spring water has worked its magic.
Sorry, that's my secret to know.
You keep the magic of the hot spring a secret.
Sacred water, collected from a spiritual hot spring!
You profess your enamoration of the holy spring you found.

Here, let me show you the special way I mix the tea. Commanding a small audience, your physician grabs a handful of ginger root and a lukewarm kettle. Suddenly, from the spout, water pours upwards, dancing in the air. With masterful precision, she throws the ginger root in with one hand, whilst keeping the water afloat with the other.
Of course, you must be a healer!
You realise your physician must be a master healer!
A mystic of the Northern Tribes!
You begin realising her health at her age makes sense, for a mystic such as herself!
You're a waterbender?!
You are dumbstruck by this revelation!
One of the oldest in our tribe, in fact!, she says, not missing a beat. The ginger root continues to swirl, making beautiful patterns, before pouring itself across several cups.
A healer, and a teabender, at my party!
You're grateful your party has been attended by such a prestigious member of the tribe!
Could you teach me the arts?
You learn the basics of healing from your old physician.

I wouldn't call myself a mystic. Most girls are raised to heal, and I just happened to pick up a few other techniques along the way. The floating tea makes a few more dazzling swirls before dropping suddenly to the table, filling the cups of all those watching. "Truly, I've always thought of myself as more of a... teabender".
Of course, the fifth element!
Your party has been blessed with such skill and entertainment!

Your physician winks at you. "Yes, in my younger days I travelled the world, touring the Nations, and healing all those in need along the way. When I found my youth spent, I settled down, and became a simple family doctor." The tea in the air continues to swish and swirl, and finally lands to fill several cups. "A technique I've perfected over the years. Go on, try some!".
You're a teabender!
She may only know one element, but what an element it is!

Strutting in from the kitchen, the Badger Spirit wanders into your tea room, to the surprise of your guests. Most seem to think it's just a pet, and some even scratch its head, of which it is oddly receptive. The weirdness only begins when the badger sits at your Pai Sho table, and abruptly lays out the pieces for a game.
Who among you can defeat my trained badger?
You're not sure where this is going, but you're interested to watch.
I will play the badger myself!
You'll probably be able to play it off as a joke, without anyone realising this is a spirit.
I'll play, but I must be wary of this spirit's knowledge.
Perhaps you can learn a thing or two from this creature?

I'll take that bet!, one of your guests boasts. The room roars with laughter as he sets up his pieces, and the man joins in with them. However, after just a few moves, it is clear the badger is the superior player, and the man is easily defeated. "How? What? This badger?", he sputters in disbelief. "I... don't know how you've managed to train him, but this badger... is a beast!".
He, uh, learned from the best.
Your guests are impressed with your fictitious animal-handling.

Sitting down at the Pai Sho table, you place your pieces on the board. As the game unfolds, however, you realise the situation is helpless. The Badger Spirit is impossibly skilled, and seems to anticipate your every move. The match is over quickly, and your guests clap and laugh, thinking the entire thing was a bit.
I meant to do that!
You lost, but at least you learned something.

You sit down at the table, aware of what you're about to get into. Your guests laugh and clap, thinking this some elaborate joke, but you know better. Obviously there's no way to read your opponent, but it is a badger, but you can probably learn something from its moves. The game starts, and you realise quickly that this creature has perhaps centuries of Pai Sho knowledge under its furry pelt.
It is impossible to win!
The Spirit's moves are impossible to counter!

The game is over quickly, and the applause from your guests has only grown louder. To them, this whole thing was a show. But, gazing into your opponents beady eyes, you sense a real pride it has in victory. Smiling, you give a small clap, and congratulate the badger.
Well played, well played!
You lost, but you walk away with a greater understanding of the game.
So many more guests showed up than you expected, and as day wanes, you begin to hear whispers among the crowd.
You listen to the whispers...
Such nasty murmurs!
It seems like a mixed bag...
Everyone is talking about what a great time they had!
I should mingle and meet some new people.

Cleaning up the tea cups and plates, you happily begin wrapping your party after a long day of revelry. However, one of your lingering guests flags you down, and calls you out to the livingroom. Apparently, a bunch of the other Tea Enthusiasts want to play Pai Sho, and since you're the host, they want you to join!
I'm tired, but I'll watch you play.
You just want to go to sleep.
Of course! I'm always ready for a game!
You can sneak in one more game before bed.
Was the badger not enough?
You remind them of the terrifying beast.

Looking at each other nervously, the guests remark they feel too tired to play against such a... strange creature. Fortunately for them, the Badger Spirit seems to have vanished. Scouring the house for where it may have gone, you eventually happen upon a small bag hewn from badger fur, full of coins!
The badger has gifted me for my hospitality!
You ponder the whimsical nature of the spirits.

With the main course served, you and your friends retire to your livingroom, for some delightful post-tea banter. Suddenly, you hear a soft-noise fill the room, and notice one of your fellow Tea Enthusiasts is gently playing a tsungi horn. Not wanting to miss out on the fun, you decide to join in yourself, with some singing!
You sing gracefully.
Winter, Spring, Summer and Fall...
Secret Tunnel!
Leaves from the vine...
It's a long, long way to Ba Sing Se!
Chakras, chakras, everybody loves chakras!
After a long day of partying, your guests begin to clear out, and you feel exhaustion washing over you. However, retiring to your bedroom, you find someone has fallen asleep in your bed!
My friend, it's time to leave.
You don't have to go home, but you can't stay here.
I have no idea who this is.
One of your extra guests got a little too comfortable!
May I offer you the guest room?
Sometimes, charity literally begins at home.
I will sleep in the guest room.
You can't bear to wake him up.
Prodding the man awake, you ask for his name, but he's apparently too drunk to answer. It looks like some of your guests were having more than just tea today!
Shameful.
You think you'd have set a better example than that!
The sun hasn't even set yet, and already the last of your guests have gone home. Today was a complete disaster.
I must learn from my mistakes.
The sun begins to set, and with it, the party has ended. You see the last of your guests trickle out, satisfied with the day they had.
Finally, it is time to sleep.
The sun has long set, and yet, guests still mill about your home. Most are having too much fun to leave, and everyone is in good spirits. This party will be spoken of for ages!
Today was perfect!
